bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, August 30, 1922

div1.p: Russell discusses yellow fever cases in Grand Bassam and West Africa. French government officials ask for medicine to combat the outbreak.

August 30, 1922
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
We cabled Mr. Gunn, our representative in
France, asking him to investigate the report of cases
of yellow fever in Grand Bassam, West Africa. We
have today received the following cable from him:

Twenty cases yellow fever Grand Bassam;
two deaths. Cases only in Grand Bassam.
No cases previously several years. First
case ten days ago. Only Europeans affec-
ted. Bassam quarantined by land and water.
Antonetti, Governor, Ivory Coast, Africa,
in Paris, France. Returns September 10,
1922. Can you send serum-therapy for
treating 100 cases and enough vaccine for
protecting 100 others, with instructions,
Chef, Service Coloniale, Bordeaux, France,
by next boat. Deaths reported in Togo-
land, Africa.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, F F Russell
Acting General Director Doctor Henry R. Carter
New Glasgow P.O.
Amherst County
Virginia
“Geddes”
